memberdef.argsstring: (const char *portName, const char *pcoPort, int maxBuffers, size_t maxMemory, int priority, int stackSize)
memberdef.name: pco

briefdescription.para: Constructor for pco driver; most parameters are simply passed to ADDriver::ADDriver.

detaileddescription.para:
After calling the base class constructor this method creates a thread to collect the detector data, and sets reasonable default values the parameters defined in this class, asynNDArrayDriver, and ADDriver.
portName
The name of the asyn port driver to be created.
serverPort
The name of the asyn port driver previously created with drvAsynIPPortConfigure connected to the pco_server program.
maxBuffers
The maximum number of NDArray buffers that the NDArrayPool for this driver is allowed to allocate. Set this to -1 to allow an unlimited number of buffers.
maxMemory
The maximum amount of memory that the NDArrayPool for this driver is allowed to allocate. Set this to -1 to allow an unlimited amount of memory.
priority
The thread priority for the asyn port driver thread if ASYN_CANBLOCK is set in asynFlags.
stackSize
The stack size for the asyn port driver thread if ASYN_CANBLOCK is set in asynFlags.

inbodydescription.para: init all params or else the client will not see them...they will be undefined...
init all params or else the client will not see them...they will be undefined...

briefdescription.para: Called when asyn clients call pasynInt32->write().

detaileddescription.para:
This function performs actions for some parameters, including ADAcquire, ADBinX, etc. For all parameters it sets the value in the parameter library and calls any registered callbacks..
pasynUser
pasynUser structure that encodes the reason and address.
value
Value to write.

briefdescription.para: Called when asyn clients call pasynFloat64->write().

detaileddescription.para:
This function performs actions for some parameters. For all parameters it sets the value in the parameter library and calls any registered callbacks..
pasynUser
pasynUser structure that encodes the reason and address.
value
Value to write.

briefdescription.para: Report status of the driver.

detaileddescription.para:
Prints details about the driver if details>0. It then calls the ADDriver::report() method.
fp
File pointed passed by caller where the output is written to.
details
If >0 then driver details are printed.

briefdescription.para: This should be private but is called from C, must be public.

detaileddescription.para: Deprecated.

briefdescription.para: Set debugging message level.

detaileddescription.para: deprecated as we use asyn to do this

briefdescription.para: Reconfig grabber on the pco serial thread.

detaileddescription.para: It must grab the grabber mutex from the grabber thread before messing w./ grabber. we assume we already have the serial port mutex. Yes- there are 2 mutexes. Serial port and grabber.

briefdescription.para: Check image to see if edge descrambling work correctly.
Called when new image comes from grabber.

detaileddescription.para:
can descramble if enabled for Edge camera. Can test pixels for repeated images. It takes a line of pixels whcih shoudl be noise, and compares to previous image. if same, then noise is not noise, and we have repeated frames.
img_ptr
A void to an NDArray. It gets cast to NDArray, so that is what we pass.

briefdescription.para: called every serial thraed loop.

detaileddescription.para: does nothing.

memberdef.name: updateParameters

briefdescription.para: Called by asyn writeInt32 and writeDouble, which pass the pasynuser and vales etc.

detaileddescription.para:
to this function. Because so many parameters, the param setting is split into many functions.
pasynUser
The standard pasynUser pointer from asyn.
ivalue-
param val if an int.
dvalue-
param val if a double.
paramtype-
enum for double or int. Deprecated and not used.

also called by pcoTask periodically.

rsp-
response to pco. It is filled in by this funciton.
obj-

len-

briefdescription.para: PCO settings are defined in PCO docs.

detaileddescription.para: Because so many, we group them as categories folling the pco docs. If functino is called get, we read serial port from camera and set a param. If function called set, we read a param from asyn param list and send its value to the camera.

briefdescription.para: Get function from writeInt32, which param.

detaileddescription.para:
Read that param from camera. PCO settings are defined in PCO docs. Because so many, we group them as categories folling the pco docs. The param defined in fucntion will be set from camera settings, or sent to camera settings on hardware ,depending on if the functino is named ReadParams, or WriteParams.

-asyn parameter number.

briefdescription.para: Get ONE frame from dimax RAM.

detaileddescription.para:
Just send the serial message to pco dimax to send next frame.
k
which frame number to return.

inbodydescription.para: ! need to do eqv of waitDone(1000);

briefdescription.para: Read out all images from dimax RAM over CL grabber.

detaileddescription.para: We must run on a thread, the seriao port thread, which is separate from the asynDriver thread on which writeInt32 runs. This function sends commmand via serial port to camera to get ONE image. Then it waits for image to show uip on grabber. then it does again and again in a loop until all iamges read out. It must be on separate thread so the writeInt32 does not block for minutes.

briefdescription.para: High level parameters are things like ADAcquire.

detaileddescription.para:
The idea of a high level param is that when set, it will set many low level params in the camera. To Acquire for example, about 5 low level settins in the camera must be tweaked.
function
from writeInt32, the parm numb.

pco.cpp Area Detector Driver for PCO cameras that use Camera Link Inherite ADCameraLink to provide Image Grabbing functions.

detaileddescription.para: this class addes all the commands/control that is sent over serial port on CL grabber.
